definition: dualism, belief that the universe is made of two different substance (e.g. mind and matter or good and evil)
two/2/(Beijing dialect) stupid
surname Yuan/the Yuan or Mongol dynasty (1279-1368)
currency unit (esp. Chinese yuan)/first/original/primary/fundamental/constituent/part/era (of a reign)/meta- (prefix)/(math.) argument/variable/(Tw) (geology) eon
abbr. for 論語|论语[Lun2 yu3], The Analects (of Confucius)
opinion/view/theory/doctrine/to discuss/to talk about/to regard/to consider/per/by the (kilometer, hour etc)

sentences.english: He was a believer in dualism for both fatalism and causality.
sentences.chinese: 他是因果与宿命的二元论者。

sentences.english: A far more uh, worrisome for the dualist, do animals have minds?
sentences.chinese: 关于二元论还有更多的担忧，动物们有思维么？

sentences.english: Put in something about the Supernal Oneness. Don't say a syllable about the Infernal Twoness.
sentences.chinese: 说一点天上的一元论，千万别谈地狱的二元论。

sentences.english: The mistake is continuing to think in terms of the old monastic dichotomies.
sentences.chinese: 这个错误是跟着古老的修道院式的二元论想法而来的。

sentences.english: Don't say a syllable about the Infernal Twoness.
sentences.chinese: 说一点天上的一元论，千万别谈地狱的二元论。

sentences.english: So that's another dualism of space.
Magee: Obviously that means not only that you reject idealism but also that you reject dualism.
sentences.chinese: 显而易见，你反对唯心主义，而且也反对二元论。

sentences.english: If your answer is no, you are a closet dualist.
sentences.chinese: 如果你的回答是不，那你私下里就是个二元论者。

sentences.english: You have,for example,three different kinds of dualisms.
His monotheistic solution resolves the old strict dualism.
sentences.chinese: 他的一神论解决方案解答了古老的严格二元论。
甚至他的词汇都是二元论。

sentences.english: So suppose I was a dualist.
Section III, the author summarized Kelsen's criticisms of the traditional dualisms of law and state.
sentences.chinese: 第三节，展示了凯尔森对法与国家传统二元论的批判。
二元论者确实可以这么说。

sentences.english: The Master wanted to train Narendra in the teachings of the non-dualistic Vedanta philosophy.
sentences.chinese: 师父希望通过教导非二元论吠檀多来训练纳兰德。

definition: monism, belief that the universe is made of a single substance
philosophy of idealism, the doctrine that external reality is a product of consciousness
metaphysics
ontology
epistemology (in philosophy, the theory of how we know things)
theism (the belief in the existence of God)
rationalism
philosophy of idealism, the doctrine that external reality is a product of consciousness
pantheism, theological theory equating God with the Universe
pluralism, philosophical doctrine that the universe consists of different substances
agnosticism, the philosophical doctrine that some questions about the universe are in principle unanswerable
(philosophy) rationalism
materialism, philosophical doctrine that physical matter is the whole of reality
deism, theological theory of God who does not interfere in the Universe
determinism
the philosophy of materialism, doctrine that physical matter is the whole of reality
